Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2012 06:25PM - edited Sep 30, 2012 06:32PM by amberzas I can't find the lump!  I feel some lumpiness, but nothing I can't feel on the other side.  I sporadically do self-checks (I bet after this, I do them more often), and I don't feel anything different than what I've felt before.  I haven't had an exam in a couple of years, so now I'm beating myself up over that.  I've always had lumpy boobs!  I'm trying to think of the positives, no history in family, it was a week before my period, and I do drink a lot of caffeine, but WOW.  This was unexpected and it totally caught me off-guard. I'm usually the one showing the Dr. things that turn out to be nothing.  I'm not used to this.  :)  Now I'm thinking about all the things that could be "symptoms".  I'm a little anxious by nature anyway.  lol
Posts.Title: This is me! amberzas jhuffman172003

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2012 06:33PM amberzas wrote: Soooo...really bummed out.  Did the mammogram, nothing found.  Did the ultrasound and they could defintely see it.  It's a black oval looking spot.  "tiny" according to the Dr.  His exact words were: You're lumpy anyway. I can't tell if it's normal breast tissue, or a tiny spot of cancer.   I wouldn't be suprised either way.  Well, I"d be a little more suprised if it's cancer.   How old are you?  33 Do you have kids?  Yes, three. History of breast cancer, ovarian cancer in family?  no Well, I want to do a biopsy.  I wouldn't want to just sit on this.  So now I have an appt. next Thursday for biopsy!  BLAH
Posts.Title: This is me! amberzas jhuffman172003

Posts.Content: amberzas wrote: I'm not diagnosed, but I am very worried--even though everyone has told me not to be.  I went to the Dr. a little over a week ago for what I thought was a yeast infection (it was).  She decided to go ahead and do my annual while I was there.  Everything was pretty normal until she got to my left breast.  She spent a LOT of time on that one.  Saying, "Well?", "I don't know", "Maybe?"  "You're 33?  It won't hurt to go ahead and get a mammogram.  You probably have fibrocystic breasts, I am NOT concerned.  It will be a good baseline anyway."  So now I'm waiting until Thursday for my diagnositc.  My mom isn't worried, my husband isn't worried, but I am scared.  What if?  I have three little kids!  I go between having a total panic attack to trying to be calm and normal.  I've been lurking on your boards all weekend and am unsucecssfully trying not to google!  I'm not sure how I'm going to make it the next four days. What's worse, for the life of me, I can't find it!   Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: amberzas wrote: So I had my biopsy today and that was weird!  It didn't hurt really, but the vacuuming/vibrating part was really unsettling.  One good thing is that he said it looked totally different today!  He was "encouraged" that it looked more cystic and fluid filled than last week.  He actually told me he "thought this one would be ok". Believe me, that's something coming from this man who obviously doesn't want to give anyone any false hope.  He did go ahead and do the biopsy just in case because he still didn't like something about it, and said he got all of it.  But atleast I have a little more hope now, right? So here's to another week of waiting.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today amberzas SillyMama
